Name: Maxwell Food Centre
Description: Located in Tanjong Pagar, this iconic centre is home to the famed Tian Tian Hainanese Chicken Rice and offers a plethora of local delights.

Name: Chinatown Complex Market & Food Centre
Description: The largest hawker centre in Singapore, boasting over 260 stalls, including the Michelin-starred Hawker Chan and the renowned Ann Chin Popiah.

Name: Amoy Street Food Centre
Description: Situated in the Central Business District, it's a lunchtime haven featuring numerous stalls recognized by the Michelin Guide.

Name: Old Airport Road Food Centre
Description: A historic centre with over 150 stalls, known for its diverse offerings like char siew rice and durian chendol.

Name: Adam Road Food Centre
Description: Famous for Selera Rasa Nasi Lemak, a dish so esteemed that it has been served to visiting dignitaries.

Name: Chomp Chomp Food Centre
Description: A Serangoon Gardens favorite, celebrated for its hokkien mee and barbecued seafood.

Name: Serangoon Garden Market
Description: Voted as the Favourite Hawker Centre in 2024, it houses popular stalls like Garden Street Kway Chap and Seng Kee Mushroom Minced Meat Noodle.

Name: Lau Pa Sat
Description: A historic market turned hawker centre, renowned for its satay street that comes alive in the evenings.

Name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre
Description: A local gem where stalls like Come Daily Fried Hokkien Prawn Mee draw long queues.

Name: Kovan 209 Market & Food Centre
Description: Known for its nostalgic dishes, offering a taste of traditional Singaporean flavors.

Name: Ghim Moh Market & Food Centre
Description: A beloved spot among locals, Ghim Moh offers delights like Sungei Road-style char kway teow, gravy-filled hor fun, and traditional snacks such as chwee kueh and chee cheong fun.

Name: Tekka Centre
Description: Situated in Little India, Tekka Centre is a haven for Indian and South Asian cuisines. Notable stalls include Allauddin's Briyani and Haji Johan Indian Muslim Food.

Name: Redhill Food Centre
Description: Known for its early morning offerings, Redhill boasts stalls like Seng Heng, famous for braised duck noodles, and Jia Xiang Mee Siam.

Name: Bedok Interchange Hawker Centre
Description: A bustling hub in the east, Bedok Interchange features stalls like Inspirasi (mee rebus, soto ayam) and Fatt Soon Kueh (soon kueh dumplings).

Name: Mei Ling Market & Food Centre
Description: A hidden gem, home to Lao Jie Fang (HK-style beef brisket noodles) and Hup Kee Teochew Fishball Noodles.

Name: Whampoa Hawker Centre
Description: Located in a cozy neighborhood, Whampoa offers crispy carrot cake and nasi lemak that draws long queues.

Name: Tiong Bahru Market & Food Centre
Description: A blend of heritage and modernity, Tiong Bahru is famed for Jian Bo Shui Kueh's chwee kueh and 178 Lor Mee's hearty lor mee.

Name: Golden Mile Food Centre
Description: A multi-level hawker centre offering local and international cuisines, including Thai and Vietnamese dishes.

Name: East Coast Lagoon Food Village
Description: A seaside hawker centre perfect for alfresco dining, known for its BBQ seafood, satay, and grilled delights.

Name: Geylang Serai Market
Description: A vibrant centre reflecting Malay culture, offering dishes like nasi padang, rendang, and traditional desserts like putu piring.
